page.title: 09KOSANGAS
page.content: Kosangas is in St.Sampsons. It distributes L.P.G. throughout the Channel Islands. Kosangas has been there for twenty six years and now has an annual turnover of Â£2.9millon per annum. The maximum people they employ are fifteen at one time. They import gas from Denmark and export it to all the Channel Islands except Jethou. The business fills up all the gas cylinders and pumps L.P.G. to Guernsey gas for conversion to town gas.They also pressure test all cylinders and completely overhaul them in line with the relevant codes of practice. There are three separate tanks and there are five tanks joined together and each of them have fire sprinklers. Recently the Board of Administration have suggested that the tanks should be resited as they are a safety hazard.LPG is Liquid Petroleum Gas.
